alert.note: Alert for Gibson; Knox; Posey (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 10 at 10:02PM EST until March 19 at 11:00PM EST by NWS Indianapolis
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Indiana... Illinois... Wabash River .Ongoing flooding will continue along portions of the East Fork White, White, and Wabash Rivers due to rainfall last weekend. Minor flooding is occurring, which primarily impacts river roads, parks, and agricultural land. The crest on the Wabash River is near Terre Haute. The crest on the White River is near Elliston. The crest on the East Fork White River is between Seymour and Rivervale. New precipitation amounts through the weekend will not impact current flooding. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL SATURDAY, MARCH 19... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Wabash River at Mount Carmel. * WHEN...Until Saturday, March 19. * IMPACTS...At 23.9 feet, Extensive lowland flooding in progress. In Wabash County Illinois, South Division Street and 1.5 miles of CR 1280 E remain flooded. High water blocks access to cabins along South Division Street and some nearby oil fields. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:45 PM CST Thursday /8:45 PM EST Thursday/ the stage was 21.7 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 7:45 PM CST Thursday /8:45 PM EST Thursday/ was 21.7 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 23.7 feet Tuesday morning. It will then fall below flood stage Saturday, March 19. - Flood stage is 19.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/ind. This statement will be updated within the next 12 to 24 hours.
